text: hi I'm Alyssa Clark from the dining
section what do you do with your let's
call them highly ripe bananas banana
bread banana muffins
a little bit sick of both of them how
about making chocolate crusted banana
Blondie's first thing you have to do is
prepare the pan I've buttered my pan I
have parchment paper I've buttered my
parchment paper and here's a little
trick if you want to be able to easily
lift the bars out of the pan when
they're baked
you should leave a little extra
parchment paper on the sides and then to
keep it from burning while it's in the
oven
just take a metal clip this is a chip
clip flip these down this is just a
binder clip actually what I've done in
this recipe is I've taken a banana
blondie batter and I've put it on top of
a chocolate wafer cookie crust so when
you eat it you get crunchy fudgy on the
bottom and then banana butterscotch on
top the hardest part about this recipe
just might be finding the right kind of
chocolate wafers to buy what you want is
something plain no cream in the middle
no nuts no chocolate chips and if you
can't find plain chocolate wafer cookies
you can substitute chocolate graham
crackers they're not quite as intensely
fudgy but they'll do the trick to make
the creme crust you just put your
chocolate wafer cookies into the food
processor whirl the min to crumbs and
then add melted butter a pinch of salt
and a little bit of light brown sugar
what it has the texture of damp sand
it's done dump it in your pan smooth
down the top and then bake it for about
seven to ten minutes in a 375 degree
oven for the exact recipe go to ed white
times.com / dining most blondie recipes
call for melted butter I'm going to take
that one step further I'm gonna melt the
butter I'm gonna let it get all nice and
brown and caramelize and that brown
butter adds amazing nutty rich flavor to
the mix it just takes about five to
seven minutes and what you're looking
for is all of the white milk solids on
top are gonna fall to the bottom of the
pan and they're gonna turn nutbrown and
it's gonna smell fragrant the next step
is to mix together the banana blondie
batter you can do it in the food
processor but I'm going to show you how
to do it by hand peel the bananas put
them in a bowl and you can use a fork to
mash them or if you have a potato masher
use that it works on bananas too into my
bananas I'm going to mix in some brown
sugar eggs dark rum and my brown butter
you want to scrape all those brown bits
off the bottom of the pan because that's
where the flavor is then mix together
your dry ingredients all-purpose flour
and then find sea salt
then combine the two I'm going to fold
in some chopped toasted walnuts if you
like chocolate chips you could use those
instead or use a combination spread it
into the pan with your nice chocolate
crust and as a final touch I'm gonna
sprinkle some flaky sea salt over the
top now I bake it at 350 for about 45
minutes to an hour this is what it looks
like when it's baked and cooled
there it is you've got chocolate on the
bottom banana blondie on the top and
both of them in my mouth
